{"repo_name": "sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes", "source_branch": "feat/editable-feed-urls", "target_branch": "main", "title": "feat: editable feed URLs with critical runtime error fix", "body": "

## Description
This PR implements the ability to edit feed URLs for each widget in the SheepVibes application.

## Critical Bug Fix
- **Issue**: The `createFeedWidget` function was appending the widget to the DOM but returning `undefined`, causing `widget.replaceWith(newWidget)` to fail at runtime
- **Solution**: Modified `createFeedWidget` to return the created widget element without appending it to the DOM
- **Result**: Fixed runtime error where widget replacement was failing

## Changes Made
- **Backend**: Added PUT endpoint `/api/feeds/<feed_id>` for updating feed URLs with validation
- **Frontend**: 
  - Added edit button (✎) to each feed widget
  - Created modal dialog for editing feed URLs with form validation
  - Implemented JavaScript functionality for the edit workflow
  - Added CSS styling for edit button and modal
- **Infrastructure**:
  - Configured CORS for frontend-backend communication
  - Fixed backend import issues and function naming conflicts
  - Ensured consistent relative imports throughout the backend

## Features
- Users can now click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget
- Modal dialog opens with current feed URL and name
- Form validation ensures valid URLs before submission
- Feed content is automatically refreshed after URL update
- Error handling for invalid URLs or network issues

## Testing
- All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)
- Edit workflow successfully updates feed URLs
- CORS configuration allows frontend-backend communication

## Code Review Feedback Addressed
- Fixed inconsistent imports by reverting to relative imports throughout the backend
- Resolved performance issues by limiting feed items in PUT responses

## Related Issues
Implements the feature requested to make feed URLs editable.

arguments.title: feat: editable feed URLs with critical runtime error fix
arguments.body:
## Description
This PR implements the ability to edit feed URLs for each widget in the SheepVibes application.

## Critical Bug Fix
- **Issue**: The `createFeedWidget` function was appending the widget to the DOM but returning `undefined`, causing `widget.replaceWith(newWidget)` to fail at runtime
- **Solution**: Modified `createFeedWidget` to return the created widget element without appending it to the DOM
- **Result**: Fixed runtime error where widget replacement was failing

## Changes Made
- **Backend**: Added PUT endpoint `/api/feeds/<feed_id>` for updating feed URLs with validation
- **Frontend**: 
  - Added edit button (✎) to each feed widget
  - Created modal dialog for editing feed URLs with form validation
  - Implemented JavaScript functionality for the edit workflow
  - Added CSS styling for edit button and modal
- **Infrastructure**:
  - Configured CORS for frontend-backend communication
  - Fixed backend import issues and function naming conflicts
  - Ensured consistent relative imports throughout the backend

## Features
- Users can now click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget
- Modal dialog opens with current feed URL and name
- Form validation ensures valid URLs before submission
- Feed content is automatically refreshed after URL update
- Error handling for invalid URLs or network issues

## Testing
- All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)
- Edit workflow successfully updates feed URLs
- CORS configuration allows frontend-backend communication

## Code Review Feedback Addressed
- Fixed inconsistent imports by reverting to relative imports throughout the backend
- Resolved performance issues by limiting feed items in PUT responses

## Related Issues
Implements the feature requested to make feed URLs editable.
